Avi-nonen Erasmus did not publish any of his letters until he was of mature age and had made a' great name, he was alive from his earliest youth to the importance attached by men of taste and learn- ing to the composition of elegant epistles, and took care to keep copies of the more interesting that he wrote. From the survival of Ep. 1 it seems probable that he had learnt at Deventer ιο write his letters into a book; and this practice continued as he grew older. Ep. 27A shows him copying the letters of Cornelius Gerard into a volume, which no doubt contained also his own early letters ιο Cornelius, Servatius Rogerus, and William Herman ¹.
